name: AI-PR-Code-Review
description: Generates a code review for a pull request using AI, support Gemini, OpenAI, Grok.
author: Lawrence Shen

inputs.name: inputAiProvider
inputs.label: AI Provider
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the AI provider to use for generating comments.

inputs.name: inputModelName
inputs.label: Gemini Model Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the Gemini model name. (e.g. gemini-2.5-flash, gemini-2.5-pro)

inputs.name: inputModelKey
inputs.label: Gemini API Key
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter your API key for the selected AI provider.

inputs.name: inputOpenAIModelName
inputs.label: OpenAI Model Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the OpenAI model name (e.g. gpt-5, gpt-5-mini, gpt-5-nano, gpt-4o, gpt-4o-mini).

inputs.name: inputGrokModelName
inputs.label: Grok Model Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the Grok model name (e.g. grok-3-mini, grok-4-fast-non-reasoning).

inputs.name: inputSystemInstruction
inputs.label: System Instruction
inputs.defaultValue:
You are a senior software engineer. Please help complete the PR code review and respond according to the following instructions.
1. Begin with a summary conclusion of the analysis, for example: AI Review Status: ✔️ Recommend Approval, ❌ Recommend Rejection, ❗ Needs Human Review, followed by a brief explanation within 100 characters, then use <hr/> for a line break.
2. Do not include any content unrelated to the code review.
3. Use Traditional Chinese (zh-TW) for the review result. Each issue should be listed as a bullet point with concise explanations.
4. Since each change may involve multiple modified files, mark each file before its corresponding review comments for easy reference.
5. If too many files are modified to analyze them all, limit the total response length to within 15,000 characters.
6. Skip analysis of images, binary files, or other non-code files.
7. Skip analysis of deleted files.
8. Use Markdown format for the reply.
inputs.helpMarkDown: System-level instructions for the AI model to guide its behavior.

inputs.name: inputPromptTemplate
inputs.label: Prompt Template
inputs.helpMarkDown: Custom prompt template for the AI model. Use {code_changes} as a placeholder for the actual code changes.

inputs.name: inputMaxOutputTokens
inputs.label: Max Output Tokens
inputs.helpMarkDown: Maximum number of output tokens for the AI model's response.

inputs.name: inputTemperature
inputs.label: Temperature
inputs.helpMarkDown: Temperature setting for the AI model to control randomness in responses.

inputs.name: inputFileExtensions
inputs.label: File Extensions to Include
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma-separated list of file extensions to include in the code review analysis. If left empty, all file types are included by default, except binary types.

inputs.name: inputBinaryExtensions
inputs.label: Binary File Extensions to Exclude
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma-separated list of binary file extensions to exclude from the code review analysis. Default includes: .jpg, .jpeg, .png, .gif, .bmp, .ico, .webp, .pdf, .doc, .docx, .ppt, .pptx, .xls, .xlsx, .zip, .tar, .gz, .rar, .7z, .exe, .dll, .so, .dylib, .bin, .dat, .class, .mp3, .mp4, .avi, .mov, .flv

inputs.name: inputEnableThrottleMode
inputs.label: Enable AI Throttle Mode
inputs.helpMarkDown: When enabled (default), only code differences are sent to AI for review. When disabled, the entire new file content is sent to AI for review.

inputs.name: inputShowReviewContent
inputs.label: Show Review Content
inputs.helpMarkDown: When enabled, the code changes, system instruction, prompt, and AI response will be printed to the console for debugging purposes.
